main event: On 19 October 1959, in Oblong, Illinois, a solid silver object with a dark center and six smaller solid discs in a ring formation were observed.
interesting points: The larger disc moved away at a fast speed and disappeared, while the six smaller discs moved off in different directions before regrouping a few minutes later., The sighting lasted approximately 10 minutes., The objects were observed continuously during the entire sighting period., The phenomenon was believed to be parhelia., Investigations failed to provide an explanation for the sighting.
sighted object: one solid silver object with a dark center and six smaller solid discs
witness description: Mr. Housley and another person were manning their GOC post when they noticed the objects.
